Modify a taxonomy group Beta

patch /{project_id}/taxonomies/{taxonomy_group_identifier}
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/taxonomies/{taxonomy_group_identifier}

Modify the specified taxonomy group and terms using the replace, remove, and addInto operations.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

taxonomy_group_identifier
required
string

The identifier of a specific taxonomy group. You can specify a taxonomy group by its internal ID (e.g., 0be13600-e57c-577d-8108-c8d860330985), external ID (e.g., external-id/Tax-Group-123), or codename {e.g., codename/personas).

Request Body schema: application/json

The operations to perform on the specified taxonomy group.

Array
op
required
string

Specifies the operation to perform.

  • replace to modify taxonomy groups or terms
  • remove to delete taxonomy terms
  • addInto to add new taxonomy terms
addInto
value
required
object

The taxonomy term object you want to add.

after
object

An optional reference to the taxonomy term after which you want to add the new taxonomy term.

For example, to add a term after the existing "Personas" term , you can set after to {codename: personas}.

Note: The before and after properties are mutually exclusive.

before
object

An optional reference to the taxonomy term before which you want to add the new taxonomy term.

For example, to add a term before the existing "Personas" term, you can set before to {codename: personas}.

Note: The before and after properties are mutually exclusive.

reference
object

Reference to existing taxonomy terms to which the new terms will be added.

Not required if you are adding the terms only to the group specified in the taxonomy_group_identifier.

Responses

200

The modified taxonomy group.

400

One of the specified operations is invalid.

404

The specified taxonomy group was not found.

Assets

Assets in Kentico Kontent consist of a reference to a binary file and metadata describing the file. Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset. Once an asset is created, the file it references cannot be changed, you can only modify the asset's descriptions and title. Note that binary files that are not used by any assets will not be visible in the Kentico Kontent UI.

Adding assets is a 2-step process

  1. Upload a binary file  after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file.
  2. Create a new asset  use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.

Asset object

descriptions
required
Array of objects

The asset's description for each active language.

file_name
required
string

The file's name.

Note: Determined by the file referenced in the file_reference property.

file_reference
required
object

Points to a specific binary file uploaded to your project.

id
required
string <uuid>

The asset's internal ID.

image_height
required
integer <int32> Nullable

The image's height in pixels. Is null if the file is not an image.

Note: Determined by the file referenced in the file_reference property.

image_width
required
integer <int32> Nullable

The image's width in pixels. Is null if the file is not an image.

Note: Determined by the file referenced in the file_reference property.

last_modified
required
string <date-time>

ISO-8601 formatted date and time of the last change to the asset.

size
required
integer <int32>

The file's size in bytes.

Note: Determined by the file referenced in the file_reference property.

title
required
string Nullable

The asset's display name. The title can be specified when adding assets, updating or upserting assets. If not specified, the title property is null.

type
required
string

The file's MIME type.

Note: Determined by the file referenced in the file_reference property.

url
required
string

The asset's URL.

external_id
string

The asset's external ID. The external ID can be specified when adding assets (POST /assets) or upserting assets (PUT /assets/external-id/<external_id>). If not specified, the external_id property is not present.

folder
object

A reference to the folder containing the asset. Not present if the asset is not in a folder.

Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
{
  • "descriptions":
    [
    • {
      • "language":
        {
        • "id": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        },
      • "description": "Alt text in default language for the asset."
      }
    ],
  • "external_id": "which-brewing-fits-you",

Upload a binary file Beta

post /{project_id}/files/{file_name}
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/files/{file_name}

Add a new file. The uploaded file will not be visible in the Kentico Kontent UI unless you add an asset using it.

Note: Maximum size limit for binary files is 100 MB.

Adding assets is a 2-step process

  1. Upload a binary file  after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file.
  2. Create a new asset  use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.
Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
file_name
required
string

Specifies the name of the uploaded binary file. The file name specified in the URL will be used for the asset name when you create an asset.

project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

header Parameters
Content-length
required
integer <int32>

Specifies the size of the binary file in bytes.

Content-type
required
string

Specifies the media type of the binary data.

Request Body schema: application/octet-stream

The binary data of the file.

string <binary>

Responses

200

A file reference to the uploaded binary file.

400

The specified request body or the provided parameters are invalid.

Request samples

  • REST
  • JavaScript
  • .NET
Copy
curl --request POST \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/975bf280-fd91-488c-994c-2f04416e5ee3/files/which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg \
  --data-binary "@which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg" \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: image/jpeg' \
  --header 'Content-length: 125770'

Response samples

  • 200
  • 400
application/json
Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
{
  • "id": "806ec84e-7c71-4856-9519-ee3dd3558583",
  • "type": "internal"
}

See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/assets

Use a file reference to link an existing binary file to a new asset. You can also create assets by upserting (PUT /assets/external-id/<external_id>).

Note: Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset.

Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Request Body schema: application/json

required
object

Points to a specific binary file uploaded to your project.

The external ID of the new asset. Use this parameter as a unique identifier for your assets.

Note: You cannot upsert external ID into already existing assets within your Kentico Kontent project.

title
string [ 1 .. 50 ] characters

List assets Beta

get /{project_id}/assets
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/assets

Retrieve a dynamically paginated list of assets.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

query Parameters
continuationToken
string
Deprecated

Determines the page of results to retrieve.

To get the next page, see the pagination object in the response and set the continuationToken parameter to the value of the continuation_token property.

header Parameters
x-continuation
string

Determines the page of results to retrieve.

To get the next page, see the pagination object in the response and set the x-continuation parameter to the value of the continuation_token property.

Responses

200

A dynamically paginated list of assets.

400

The specified continuation token is incorrect.

Upsert an asset Beta

put /{project_id}/assets/{asset_identifier}
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/assets/{asset_identifier}

Update an existing asset or add a new asset specified by external ID.

Note: If no asset with the specified external ID exists in the project, the system will try to create one. For existing assets, the API updates only the specified asset's descriptions and title.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
asset_identifier
required
string

Identifies an asset by its internal ID (e.g., fcbb12e6-66a3-4672-85d9-d502d16b8d9c) or external ID (e.g., external-id/which-brewing-fits-you).

  • When adding a new asset, use an external ID as the asset's identifier.
  • When updating an existing asset, identify the asset either by its internal ID or external ID.

External IDs

If the specified external ID is not used by an existing asset, the API will create a new asset. For existing assets, the API updates only the specified asset's descriptions and title.

project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

Request Body schema: application/json

The asset to update or create.

One of
  • UpdateAsset
  • CreateAsset
descriptions
required
Array of objects

Asset descriptions for each active language.

folder
object

A reference to the folder the asset should be placed in. To return an asset to the top level outside any folders, use "id" : "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000".

title
string [ 1 .. 50 ] characters

The title of the new asset. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI.

Responses

200

The specified asset was updated.

201

The specified asset was created.

400

The request body is invalid.

Request samples

  • Payload
  • REST
  • JavaScript
  • .NET
application/json

Copy
 Expand all Collapse all

  • "title": "Coffee Brewing Techniques",

    • {
      • "language":
        {
        • "codename": "en-US"

      • "description": "Coffee Brewing Techniques"
      },
    • {
      • "language":
        {
        • "codename": "es-ES"

      }
    ]

Modify asset folders Beta

patch /{project_id}/folders
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/folders

Modify the folders in your project using the addInto, remove, and rename operations.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

Request Body schema: application/json

The operation to perform on the folders.

Array
op
required
string

Specifies the operation to perform.

  • addInto to add new folders
  • remove to delete folders
  • rename to rename folders
addInto
value
required
object

The folder object you want to add.

after
object

An optional reference to the existing folder after which you want to add the new folder.

Note: The before and after properties are mutually exclusive.

before
object

An optional reference to the existing folder before which you want to add the new folder.

Note: The before and after properties are mutually exclusive.

reference
object

Reference to the existing folder to which the new folders will be added.

Responses

200

The modified folders in the project.

400

The specified request body is invalid.

Request samples

  • Payload
  • REST
application/json

 Expand all Collapse all

Project validation

After importing your content in Kentico Kontent, you can validate the whole project to find out whether there are any issues within the imported content.

Project report object

A project validity report contains a list of issues found in language variants and content types. The issues can indicate that either certain elements reference non-existing objects or contain values that do not meet the limitations set by a content type.

project
required
object

The project object contains the project ID and display name.

type_issues
required
Array of objects

Report of the problems found in the project's content types.

variant_issues
required
Array of objects

Report of the problems found in the project's content.

Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
{
  • "project":
    {
    • "id": "975bf280-fd91-488c-994c-2f04416e5ee3",
    • "name": "Sample Project"
    },
  • "variant_issues":
    [
    • {
      • "item":
        {
        • "id": "b2fea94c-73fd-42ec-a22f-f409878de187",

        },
      • "language":
        {
        • "id": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",

        • "codename": "en-US"
        },
      • "issues":
        [
        • {
          • "element":
            {
            • "id": "ee7c3687-b469-6c56-3ac6-c8dfdc8b58b5",

            },
          • "messages":
            [
            • "Element 'Related articles' contains a content module Colombia Carlos Imbachi of type Coffee that is not allowed in this context."
            ]
          }
        ]
      },
    • {
      • "item":
        {
        • "id": "cf106f4e-30a4-42ef-b313-b8ea3fd3e5c5",
        • "name": "Coffee Beverages Explained",

        },
      • "language":
        {
        • "id": "d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8",
        • "name": "Spanish (Spain)",
        • "codename": "es-ES"
        },
      • "issues":
        [
        • {
          • "element":
            {
            • "id": "b9dc537c-2518-e4f5-8325-ce4fce26171e",

            • "Element 'Product status' contains references to non-existing taxonomy group with ID 79b1c5b6-30bc-d076-a236-d9ec9f1ff01b."

      }

}

Element issue object

For each issue found in a specific language variant or content type, the issues array will contain an element issue with metadata about the element and a list of validation messages describing the problem.

A note on terminology in messages: A "content module" is a content item referenced in Linked items or Rich text elements. See Linked content and components for more details.

element
required
object

Information about the given object.

messages
required
Array of strings

Validation messages for the content element.

A note on terminology in messages: A "content module" is a content item referenced in the Linked items or Rich text elements. See Linked content and components for more details.

Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
{
  • "element":
    {
    • "id": "23375e4a-2ed8-42bf-aa3a-dfb32e6a42ec",
    • "name": "Body copy",
    • "codename": "content"
    },
  • "messages":
    [
    • "Element 'Body copy' contains an image 'Screenshot.png' that doesn't match the set limits: maximum width = 1280px."
    ]
}

Validate project content Beta

post /{project_id}/validate
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/validate

Checks your project's content items for issues, such as:

  • Content elements referencing non-existing objects.
  • Values of content elements not meeting the limitations configured in content types.
  • Content types referencing non-existing taxonomy groups.

We recommend that you use this endpoint after successfully importing content into your project.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

Responses

200

A project report summarizing the issues found in the specified project.

Request samples

  • REST
  • JavaScript
  • .NET
Copy
curl --request POST \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/975bf280-fd91-488c-994c-2f04416e5ee3/validate \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

Webhooks

Webhooks are useful for receiving notifications when something in your project changes, such as newly published content. Learn more about webhook types and how they are put into practice.

Webhook object

name
required
string [ 1 .. 200 ] characters

The webhook's display name.

secret
required
string non-empty

The webhook's secret key, used to authenticate that the webhook was sent by Kentico Kontent.

triggers
required
object

The events that will trigger this webhook being sent. At least one valid trigger is required.

url
required
string <url> [ 1 .. 250 ] characters

The URL to which the webhook notification will be sent.

id
string <uuid>

The webhook's internal ID.

last_modified
string <date-time>

ISO-8601 formatted date/time of the last change to the webhook.

Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
{
  • "last_modified": "2019-09-18T09:29:08.4356117Z",
  • "id": "5df74e27-1213-484e-b9ae-bcbe90bd5990",
  • "name": "Example webhook",
  • "url": "https://example.com/webhook",
  • "secret": "secret_key",
  • "triggers":
    {
    • "delivery_api_content_changes":
      [
      • {
        • "type": "content_item_variant",
        • "operations":
          [
          • "publish",
          • "unpublish"
          ]
        },
      • {
        • "type": "taxonomy",
        • "operations":
          [
          • "archive",
          • "restore",
          • "upsert"
          ]
        }
      ],
    • "workflow_step_changes":
      [
      • {
        • "type": "content_item_variant",
        • "transitions_to":
          [
          • {
            • "id": "b4363ccd-8f21-45fd-a840-5843d7b7f008"
            },
          • {
            • "id": "88ac5e6e-1c5c-4638-96e1-0d61221ad5bf"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
}

Add a webhook Beta

post /{project_id}/webhooks
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/webhooks

Add new webhooks to a given project.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

Request Body schema: application/json

The webhook to be added.

name
required
string [ 1 .. 200 ] characters

The webhook's display name.

secret
required
string non-empty

The webhook's secret key, used to authenticate that the webhook was sent by Kentico Kontent.

triggers
required
object

The events that will trigger this webhook being sent. At least one valid trigger is required.

url
required
string <url> [ 1 .. 250 ] characters

The URL to which the webhook notification will be sent.

Responses

201

The added webhook object.

400

The specified request body is invalid.

Delete a webhook Beta

delete /{project_id}/webhooks/{webhook_identifier}
See full URL

Management API v2 (BETA)

https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/{project_id}/webhooks/{webhook_identifier}

Delete a webhook specified by its internal ID.

Authorizations:
Bearer
path Parameters
project_id
required
string

Identifies your project.

webhook_identifier
required
string

Identifies a specific webhook by its internal ID.

Responses

204

The specified webhook was deleted from the project.

404

The specified webhook was not found.

Request samples

  • REST
Copy
curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects/975bf280-fd91-488c-994c-2f04416e5ee3/webhooks/d53360f7-79e1-42f4-a524-1b53a417d03e \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

Response samples

  • 404
application/json
Copy
 Expand all Collapse all
